newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnamese Tupolev skids off runway, one hurt.
newsitem.headline: Vietnamese Tupolev skids off runway, one hurt.

text.p: A Vietnam Airlines passenger plane skidded off the runway at Danang airport at the weekend, injuring an airline technician, a spokesman for the national carrier said on Monday.

He declined to give further details or comment on a report in the Lao Dong newspaper, which said the Russian-made Tupolev TU-134's front wheel support collapsed on landing at the central coast town on Saturday evening.
Lao Dong said the aircraft, on a regular domestic flight from Hanoi, skidded along the runway on its nose before coming to a halt.
The state-owned airline no longer uses its Russian planes, which include six TU-134s, for international flights and plans to phase them out altogether by the end of next year.
